original: Bergström, Viktor Albert, lektor, Linköping, f. 31/8/05 i Hälsingborg av Petter B. o. Bina Pettersson. G. 38 m. Anne-Marie Löf. Barn: Gunnar f. 39, Kerstin 43. — Stud:ex. i Hälsingborg 24, fil. kand. i Lund 26, fil. mag. 27, fil. lic. 28, fil. dr 35, provår i Lund 33-34. Docent v. Lunds univ. 35-36. Res. t. Tyskl. o. Ital. 29, Tyskl. (m. stip.) 30, Danm., Norge o. Frankr. Vik. adj. i Ystad 31-32, e. o. lektor i Söderhamn 34-35, lektor i Haparanda 36, lektor i matem. o. fysik v. Linköp. folksk:sem. sed. 40. Skr.: vet:skapl. avh.
translated: Bergström, Viktor Albert, lecturer, Linköping, b. 31/8/05 in Hälsingborg to parents Petter B. and Bina Pettersson. Married in 1938 to Anne-Marie Löf. Children: Gunnar b. 1939, Kerstin b. 1943. Education: graduated high school (Stud:ex.) in Hälsingborg in 1924, earned bachelor's degree (fil. kand.) in Lund in 1926, master's degree (fil. mag.) in 1927, licentiate degree (fil. lic.) in 1928, doctorate (fil. dr) in 1935, and completed a probationary period in Lund from 1933-34. He became a docent at Lund University from 1935-36. He traveled to Germany and Italy in 1929 with subsequent trips to Germany (with a stipend) in 1930 as well as Denmark, Norway, and France. He was a temporary teacher in Ystad from 1931-32, an acting lecturer in Söderhamn from 1934-35, and a lecturer in mathematics and physics at the Linköping public school seminar from 1940 onward. He has written scientific treatises.

structured.name: Viktor Albert Bergström
structured.additionalName: Matem. o. fysik v. Linköp. folksk:sem. sed. 40
structured.description: Swedish lecturer and docent known for his work in mathematics and physics at the Linköping public school seminar. He was born in Hälsingborg in 1905 to parents Petter B. and Bina Pettersson. He married Anne-Marie Löf in 1938, and they have two children: Gunnar (1939) and Kerstin (1943). His education includes a high school diploma from Hälsingborg High School in 1924, a bachelor's degree and a master's degree from Lund University in 1926 and 1927 respectively, a licentiate degree and a doctoral degree in 1928 and 1935 respectively. Viktor taught in several locations, including Ystad, Söderhamn, and Linköping. He has written scientific treatises.
